my favorate game

Dead by daylight conceptually is a fun game. When I first started playing the game, I had a blast. I played with friends and while we were low ranked and casual, the game was super fun. Over time we improved and while the toxic community was a struggle at times, the core game still stayed mostly fun. Eventually I reached a point where I was too high ranked to find fun matches and decided to call it a day for a bit.

I eventually came back for the RE chapter and early in I had a fairly fun time, but as SOON as I ranked out of the absolute bottom of the ladder, suddenly my game quality PLUMMETED. I was green rank and being consistently ranked with the best players in the game who would absolutely crush it every time while also being super toxic. It was an absolutely horrible experienced and I decided to take a break until I deranked back down into the fun ranks.

I've returned to the game one last time, and I'm here to tell you: There is no fun ranks anymore. Even at absolute 0 bottom of the latter, the game feels it's okay to match me with rank 1 players who completely destroy any possibility of fun. I'm not sure if it's a failure of the matchmaking system or a lack of casual players anymore, but all I can tell you is this; Don't come into this game thinking you can have a fun, casual time. You won't find it.

All you'll find is a buggy mess of a game where every player on the other side wants to crush you and grief you as hard as possible.

This game was fun before, but I think Behavior doesn't understand how to keep fun in their game. I think they've let the toxicity of the community absolutely destroy the community and I don't think there's any saving this game anymore. I've uninstalled, and I won't be coming back.
The best assymetrical game Ive played

It's one of those games where the concept is really good but the developer seems to misunderstand their audience in building upon it. They keep adding new content that is really fun, but as they can't be bothered to balance old content you'll just be repeatedly screwed over by bad decisions they made years ago.

At current the game is incredibly easy for survivors and incredibly frustrating as a killer. The devs have said that they're currently looking into taking more power away from the killers to stop tactics based around camping, tunneling and slugging (basically tactics killers use to get any sort of value out of survivors that are using meta perks). So DBD will likely continue to get worse and worse over time. The game also penalizes you significantly in power for being a new player and you will be forced to play against really experienced players.

Game concept isn't bad, to simplify it's 4v1 hide and seek with some additional objectives. 
May be fun if you play with 3-4 of your friends, otherwise give up.

If you value time, stay away from this game. The grind is insane, to unlock most meta perks you'll have to play a lot. And I really mean a lot. There are 2 perks which easen the grind a bit, 1 for survivor and 1 for killer (the killer one is behind a paywall, unless you're lucky to find the perk in shop for in-game currency)

If you are casual gamer who'd like to play from time to time, also give up. 
Recently there was implemented "skill based mmr" which according to devs works after some games played. Unfortunately it doesn't seem to work, despite me having played some matches since it's live. 
So either you'll be stomped, or you'll play with potatoes, rarely something in between.

Tutorial is very basic, there is no mode to train more advanced tactics. Actually there is no mode to even properly warm up, as games vs AI always put you against same kind of killer and you can't bring perks/items with you.

I know multiplayer games are prone to attract toxicity and so on, but honestly, even LoL had more decent community, and at least reporting system actually did anything. Here if you play with cheater, unless you provide a videoproof (you'd have to record your game, harvest bunch of information about you and the reported one, get to external website and put it all together there) almost certainly no action will be taken. Most games have some sort of logs or even auto-recording matches for such issues, that's not the case here.

Balance is dead, but let's be serious, how many multiplayer games are balanced?
Even though, you shouldn't have few usefull perks and ton of perks which you won't touch at all.
According to wiki, there are 185 perks, of which maybe 20-30(optimistically) are actually useful.

Same goes for chosing your killer character. Why bother playing some long forgotten killers who were nerfed to the ground, when you can play 1-2 all the time that are optimal to win?

Don't know if devs are actually trying to fix the balance issue to be honest. I mean since I play there were some legitimate fixes (fixing mori) which was unbalanced for surivivors, yet keys which are mentioned pretty often on the forum as they're breaking the balance for killers weren't adressed yet.

New character are being released, so one can't complain about lack of new content, but old ones are rarely "updated" to standard. 
Often even the newly released killers are so weak that you will rarely meet them in the game (dunno when was last time I saw Twins or Pyramidhead in-game despite them being newer than older).

Rather than focusing on balance improvements and game health overall, gamedevs are focused on pulling as much cash as possible from you. Who needs fixed common issues, when you can buy newly released cosmetic instead?
Don't get me wrong here, I didn't buy anything from them apart from the game and few dlcs on sale. Cosmetics are nice, but seriously, get your priorities straight.

TL:DR
Don't buy this game, if you're really that curious, check it out on some free weekend, or on the Xbox gamepass as it's available here too.
IMO it's not worth your money, nor time.

Un excellent jeu toujours mise a jour avec de nouveaux DLC regulierement, de quoi vous tenir toujours en haleine ! 5 joueurs, un tueur et 4 survivants. Ces derniers doivent activer 5 generateurs pour ouvrir les portes qui leurs permettront d'echapper au tueur. Aucune situation n'est identique, de nombreuses maps, de nombreux survivants et tueurs...Ca fait 3 ans que j'y joue,  pret de 500 heures de jeu et c'est pas fini. Definitivement un MUST HAVE !!

love the game play and interactivity. This is a great game to stream and discuss strategies and educate everyone who might be a new or veteran player.

I remember first buying this game and was like, why would I play a game where a killer bullies me and my friends to death. After playing for some time, getting better, sometimes surviving, something clicked. I reach a point in this game where now I was bullying the killer. No other game has ever given me the satisfaction of causing somebody grief on the other side. It reminds me of the days where somebody teabags you in Halo Reach, but this game makes it much more satisfying when the killer in postgame chat messages that we are toxic. Good
